item.title: Are G M Breweries Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: G M Breweries Ltd's latest Q3 FY26 results are strong, with net sales up 21.89% year-on-year and net profit increasing by 91.22%, marking the highest quarterly revenue in the company's history and showcasing improved operational efficiency and profitability. The company maintains a debt-free balance sheet and strong profitability metrics, indicating a positive financial trajectory. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Are Axita Cotton Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Axita Cotton Ltd's latest Q2 FY26 results show modest revenue growth of 1.14% year-on-year, but profitability has significantly declined, with a net profit drop of 61.22% and an operating profit margin of -0.32%. Overall, the company faces serious operational challenges despite a strong balance sheet. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Cello World Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend
item.description: Cello World Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average crosses below the 200-day moving average. item.title: Q3 FY2026 Earnings Review: Mixed Results Across Market Caps with Mid Caps Leading Profit Growth
item.description: The September 2025 quarter earnings season has revealed a nuanced picture across Indian equities, with 4,047 companies reporting results. While the overall proportion of positive earnings outcomes remains moderate at 42.0%, sectoral and market capitalisation distinctions underscore pockets of strength and emerging opportunities for investors. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Sensex and Nifty Slip Amid Mixed Sectoral Trends; Pharma Leads Gains
item.description: Indian equity markets closed lower on 6 Jan 2026, with the Sensex retreating 376.28 points (-0.44%) to 85,063.34 and the Nifty 50 shedding 71.6 points (-0.27%) to finish at 26,178.70. Despite the modest declines, the Nifty remains within striking distance of its 52-week high, trading just 0.74% below the peak of 26,373.20. Market breadth was weak, with declines outnumbering advances across the BSE500 index, reflecting cautious investor sentiment amid mixed sectoral trends and subdued foreign institutional activity. Time: 4 hours ago
